DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Diagnosis Subtract Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Day Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of the initial pathologic diagnosis to the date the patient was clinically diagnosed with the primary malignancy, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Tumor Clinical Diagnosis Subtract Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The act of removing a part from the whole._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Primary Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Diagnosis Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDDP LUAD clinical form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/13/16 Changed the concept first to clinical per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/27/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to Date of Clinical Diagnosis

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CDDP LUAD clinical data form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/13/2016 Changed first to clinical in name, definition and question text per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/27/2016
